href=\"http://www.manticgames.com/mantic-shop/dreadball.html\"><strong>DreadBall</strong></a> and the mass battle wargame <a href=\"http://www.manticgames.com/mantic-shop/warpath.html\"><strong>Warpath</strong></a>, our games are simple and innovative, making them easy to learn, fast to play and above all else, fun. id=\"Column6\" class=\"CmsColumn\">\n\t\t<div id=\"CMSModule_41821\" class=\"CMSModule\">\n\n<h3 class=\"modTitle\">Latest updates</h3></div><div id=\"CMSModule_41822\" class=\"CMSModule\">\n\n<div class=\"rssFeedDisplay\">\n    <div id=\"FeedContainer\" class=\"feedContainer\">\n       \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl00_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Coach Andrew Jashyn\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Firefight Spotlight – Coach Andrew Jashyn</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>In the third of our Warpath Community Blogs, Coach Andrew Jashyn tells us how he came to be playing Firefight. Over to you, Coach! “Man, I loved Warhammer 40K. I loved the game, the lore and especially rolling buckets of dice. It was a great obsession. The hobby, converting the models, I was in all the way. Then, about 4 years ago I went to Adepticon and met a crazy and energetic English fellow that introduced me to a skirmish game that came with this awesome cubed terrain. That was the turning point. I picked up a starter box, boosters and a few Mercs. When I got back from the con, we stopped playing Warhammer 40K and replaced it with Deadzone. I was hooked again on a smaller, faster and better game. It was all we played and obsessed over. I loved the models and the lore. Fast forward one year, I bring the Forge Fathers to the first Deadzone tournament, and become the Adepticon 2015 Deadzone champ. But something was missing. While Deadzone is my favorite game by far, I still miss all those buckets of dice. When I started to inquire about Warpath I was surprised what I [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/20/firefight-spotlight-coach-andrew-jashyn/\">Firefight Spotlight – Coach Andrew Jashyn</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Thu, 20 Apr 2017 16:00:39 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl00_hylUrl\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Coach Andrew Jashyn\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/20/firefight-spotlight-coach-andrew-jashyn/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl01_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Mantic Games at Salute 2017\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Mantic Games at Salute 2017</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>Salute is the biggest event in the UK wargaming calendar (well, apart from the Mantic Open Days, of course) and this Saturday (April 22nd) we’ll be there in style! For starters, we’ll be celebrating the launch of Warpath – our epic sci-fi battle game – and we’ll have the UK launch of the show exclusive Lee and Clementine booster for The Walking Dead: All Out War. Our Salute highlights include: FREE MINI! come to the Mantic stand (TB03) and claim your free Walking Dead: All Out War Walker. That’s right, a cool miniature that’s completely free… while stocks last. THE UK LAUNCH OF LEE AND CLEMENTINE! This will be your first opportunity to pick up the show exclusive Lee and Clementine Walking Dead booster in the UK and we’ll have very limited numbers at Salute. Don’t worry, the set will be available online during the Mantic Open Day on May 6th too. TRY OUT WARPATH! We’ll be holding demos inspired by the Operation Heracles Two-player Battle Set, giving you the chance to go hands-on with the swift and deadly Enforcers or the stalwart Forge Fathers. CAN YOU SURVIVE AGAINST THE UNDEAD? Take to the streets of Atlanta in our Walking [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/19/mantic-games-salute-2017/\">Mantic Games at Salute 2017</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Wed, 19 Apr 2017 15:06:49 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl01_hylUrl\" title=\"Mantic Games at Salute 2017\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/19/mantic-games-salute-2017/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl02_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Forge Father Starter Force\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Guide to Warpath: Forge Father Starter Force</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>Time for the third look at the Starter Forces in May’s line up! Today, the doughty Forge Fathers of the Star Realm take the spotlight as we go through the new Forge Father Starter Force. The Forge Father Starter Force contains a great variety of heavily armoured dwarfs that are capable of protecting the interests of the Star Realm… with brutal consequences, if necessary. As always, there is a good core of hard plastic infantry – 30 Steel Warriors – in the set. These sprues are really versatile, as they allow you to build not only the Steel Warriors, but many of the different kinds of veterans available to the Forge Father army. These are specialised units wielding heavy weapons for dealing with massed armour or hordes of infantry. The Steel Warriors are solid infantry. They have a higher than average defence stat and come with the Headstrong special rule, which allows them to remove suppression each turn. They can be upgraded to take a unit leader and a Hailstorm Autocannon, which, combined with their own weaponry, is great at supressing enemy units. All of their ranged weapons are armour piercing, which allows them to take on foes with a [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/18/guide-warpath-forge-father-starter-force/\">Guide to Warpath: Forge Father Starter Force</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Tue, 18 Apr 2017 16:30:15 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl02_hylUrl\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Forge Father Starter Force\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/18/guide-warpath-forge-father-starter-force/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl03_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Joe Neet\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Firefight Spotlight – Joe Neet</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>In the second of our articles focusing on American Warpath players, Joe Neet talks about taking his monstrous Plague Strike Team for Deadzone and turning it in a full Firefight army. Warpath has been around longer than some realize, and I am very excited to see this fantastic game being revitalized! Deadzone has been a great system for fast, fun and furious skirmishes across the war torn universe. However, I for one cannot wait for larger battles filled with tanks and scores of infantry. Warpath and Firefight have combined what I love from Kings of War, smooth gameplay on a large scale, and have added some unique mechanics like Strategic Assets and Command Dice. These mechanics add a whole new dimension to the game, not only is there your miniatures and scenery, but now you as the player have decisions and actions that can affect the outcome of the game. Let’s quickly look at what Commands are and show an example. Commanders are able to influence their army to go above and beyond their normal limits. Certain units and characters will have a Command Value that will determine what and how well then command their troops. Your command pool is [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/13/firefight-spotlight-joe-neet/\">Firefight Spotlight – Joe Neet</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Thu, 13 Apr 2017 10:03:12 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl03_hylUrl\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Joe Neet\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/13/firefight-spotlight-joe-neet/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl04_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Veer-Myn Starter Force\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Guide to Warpath: Veer-Myn Starter Force</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>Following on from yesterday’s look at the Enforcer Starter Force, today we will be going over another army set in detail – the insidious Veer-Myn. These secretive creatures seemed to have followed mankind expansion across the stars and now stand ready to strike from the shadows. At fifty-one miniatures, the Veer-Myn Starter Force has the highest model count of the new sets – a true horde of vicious rodents to overwhelm other forces! The main core of the force is made up of Nightcrawler infantry. Rather than being fielded as large units as you might expect, Nightcrawlers are instead limited to small teams of five. On the tabletop, this plays in an odd way, saturating your opponent with more targets than they could possibly hope to counter. Whilst each unit is weak on their own, when used in cohesion they can be very powerful – this is the basis on which the Veer-Myn force is built. Each Nightcrawler unit can be upgraded with a Malignus – this is a cross between a heavy weapon operator and a leader. These can be used to add potent (if unstable) firepower to a unit, making one of your tiny Nightcrawler units suddenly very [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/12/guide-warpath-veer-myn-starter-forces/\">Guide to Warpath: Veer-Myn Starter Force</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Wed, 12 Apr 2017 16:19:22 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl04_hylUrl\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Veer-Myn Starter Force\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/12/guide-warpath-veer-myn-starter-forces/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl05_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Enforcer Starter Force\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Guide to Warpath: Enforcer Starter Force</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>Next month sees the release of not one, but four new army sets for Warpath, covering the Enforcers, Forge Fathers, Veer-Myn and Asterans. These Starter Forces are perfect for getting a new army on to the battlefield, containing lots of core troops supported by elite units and force commanders. We’re even releasing four new heroes to fight alongside them too- you’ll hear more on each of these later! Today, we’ll be taking a look through the Enforcer Starter Force and how to use its contents on the tabletop. The core of any Enforcer Strike Team are the Enforcers themselves. Although considered to be line troopers in the context of the army, they are anything but when compared to other forces. Enforcers are mankind’s super-soldiers – designed to take on any threat to the GCPS. The Starter Force comes with twenty hard plastic Enforcers, who can be built as either strike squads with ranged weaponry, or assault squads with close-quarters weaponry. You can upgrade these with specialist equipment, such as Burst Lasers or Incinerators and there’s even components to build a sergeant, who can take an Energy Gauntlet. Personally, I would run these in two units of ten models each. Ten [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/11/guide-warpath-enforcer-starter-force/\">Guide to Warpath: Enforcer Starter Force</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Tue, 11 Apr 2017 16:23:38 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl05_hylUrl\" title=\"Guide to Warpath: Enforcer Starter Force\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/11/guide-warpath-enforcer-starter-force/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl06_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Shane Knerl\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Firefight Spotlight – Shane Knerl</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>This is the first in a series of community spotlights from our American Warpath and Firefight players. First up is Shane Knerl. Over to you Shane… Deadzone was exactly the game I was looking for coming from light skirmish games like Heroscape. It introduced the painting and modeling aspect of the hobby in an inexpensive format with great models to work with. After a while I started to look for a larger, deeper game. What made Warpath and Firefight so appealing was that the models I had been collecting for Deadzone are compatible. My Deadzone Enforcers blended seamlessly into Firefight, and as I add more units and vehicles, the step up to Warpath will be just as easy. The expanded playing field of a 4×4 or 4×6 grid-less map means that all of my Battlezones terrain has become part of the fray. I can scatter it about, making the scenes I imagine when reading the various sourcebooks and novels like First Strike. When deciding on a faction, I wanted to try one that I hadn’t played before in Deadzone – having played melee heavy factions like the Plague, the long-range survivability of the Enforcers and even tried the balanced options [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/06/getting-started-firefight-deadzone/\">Firefight Spotlight – Shane Knerl</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Thu, 06 Apr 2017 15:15:48 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl06_hylUrl\" title=\"Firefight Spotlight – Shane Knerl\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/06/getting-started-firefight-deadzone/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl07_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Battlezones Sci-Fi Scenery\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Battlezones Sci-Fi Scenery</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>Battlezones are modular hard plastic sets that allow you to build sci-fi scenery, both large and small, suited to any purpose. You can use these&nbsp;in RPGs, large wargames (like Warpath) or small tabletop skirmish games, like Deadzone. Every component in the range is compatible with each&nbsp;other, which makes your buildings truly modular. You can create anything from a small storage module, to a sprawling cityscape, or a fortified military complex. You could even go so far as to assemble a large scale spacecraft to fight desperate skirmishes across the hull or inside the bulkheads. There’s a wide range of themes available and the photographs shown are guidelines for assembly, rather than set buildings. From fortified to ruined, you’ll be able to find many buildings to use in Deadzone, Warpath or indeed any sci-fi game you happen to have in your collection… although why would you have any non-Mantic games 😉 Deadzone As scenery is so important in skirmish games, we thought we would create some exclusive web bundles that not only give you lots of great, modular terrain but also the rules to play a game that requires plenty of terrain. So, if you pick up one of the following [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/05/battlezones-sci-fi-scenery/\">Battlezones Sci-Fi Scenery</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Wed, 05 Apr 2017 17:11:49 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl07_hylUrl\" title=\"Battlezones Sci-Fi Scenery\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/05/battlezones-sci-fi-scenery/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl08_imgFeedItem\" title=\"Mantic Points Rewards – The Walking Dead: All Out War\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">Mantic Points Rewards – The Walking Dead: All Out War</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>You can now trade in your Mantic Points for three iconic characters&nbsp;from The Walking Dead: All Out War. These miniatures and cards were previously only available through the Kickstarter Edition of the game, but are now available to those who have collected enough Mantic Points. The infamous Negan is probably the hardest character to kill in the game at the moment. He has eight health, two white dice for his defence and thanks to his Die Hard special rule, he takes one less damage from melee. Be very afraid – which, incidentally, is his style of leadership. Negan’s Leader Ability, Rule Through Fear, lets him execute one friendly model within his kill zone (and replace them with a walker) in exchange for additional actions for the other members of the group, thankfully excluding Negan himself. On top of all of this, Negan is terrifying in melee, rolling one blue and one red dice on his own, which is further supplemented by his faithful baseball bat, Lucille. The weapon grants two extra white dice, plus another white dice if Negan rolls any ! hits. Finally, all of the attack with Lucille have the Bludgeon keyword – giving it a chance of [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/04/mantic-points-rewards-walking-dead-all-out-war/\">Mantic Points Rewards – The Walking Dead: All Out War</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Tue, 04 Apr 2017 16:22:18 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl08_hylUrl\" title=\"Mantic Points Rewards – The Walking Dead: All Out War\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/04/04/mantic-points-rewards-walking-dead-all-out-war/\" target=\"_blank\">Click for full story</a>\n            <br class=\"clear\">\n        </div>\n    \n        <div class=\"feedItem\">\n            <img id=\"repFeed_ctl09_imgFeedItem\" title=\"The Walking Dead: All Out War Special Offer!\" src=\"/SiteData/Root/SiteImages/feeds/rssFeedIcon.png\" border=\"0\">\n            <span class=\"feedTitle\">The Walking Dead: All Out War Special Offer!</span>\n            <span class=\"feedArticle\"><p>We were recently rather appalled, shocked and disgusted to hear that some of you poor souls still have not had the absolute pleasure of playing The Walking Dead: All Out War, so read on to hear about how we’re going to change that… Despite being available in stores since December, we’ve heard some terrible stories that some unlucky folk have not experienced this wonderful game. And that’s a real shame because there are some great reasons why The Walking Dead: All Out War is so brilliant… The Noise mechanic that controls the movement of the Walkers is intuitive and adds an extra element to tactics You can create your own gang of Survivors armed with a range of different equipment, so you can tailor your options depending upon your opponent It plays in a space as small as a small boardgame, but you can scale it up to a full on wargame with dozens of miniatures It features some of the best – if not the best – miniatures we’ve ever made and they’re pre-assembled, so you’re ready to play straight from the box Last, but by no means least, it’s based on The Walking Dead. This is your chance [...]</p>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/03/31/the-walking-dead-all-out-war-special-offer/\">The Walking Dead: All Out War Special Offer!</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://manticblog.com\">Mantic Blog</a>.</p>\n</span>\n            <span class=\"feedDate\">Fri, 31 Mar 2017 14:39:23 +0000</span>\n            <a id=\"repFeed_ctl09_hylUrl\" title=\"The Walking Dead: All Out War Special Offer!\" class=\"feedUrl external\" href=\"https://manticblog.com/2017/03/31/the-walking-dead-all-out-war-special-offer/\"
